code: @Manual{,   title = {didintrjl: Intersection Difference-in-Differences},   author = {Eric Jamieson},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.2.2},   url = {https://ebjamieson97.github.io/didintrjl/}, }

title: Intersection Difference-in-Differences
text: didintrjl R wrapper Julia package DiDInt.jl, implements intersection difference--differences (-INT), method developed Karim & Webb (2025). -INT allows unbiased estimation average effect treatment treated (ATT) cases common causal covariates (CCC) assumption violated.

title: Intersection Difference-in-Differences
text: can install development version didintrjl : Since didintrjl wrapper Julia pacakage DiDInt.jl, may need update Julia package time time. can directly R using brilliant JuliaConnectoR package didintrjl uses interface Julia.

title: Intersection Difference-in-Differences
text: Julia >= 1.10.0 DiDInt.jl = v0.6.15

title: Intersection Difference-in-Differences
text: didint() function returns object class DiDIntObj three S3 methods: print(), summary(), coef(). methods argument level can take either "agg" "sub" order distinguish aggregate results sub-aggregate results. example, staggered adoption setting several different treatment times, setting level = "sub" return information pertinent distinct treatment times, whereas level = "agg" return aggregated results.

title: Intersection Difference-in-Differences
text: didint_plot() function returns object class DiDIntPlotObj one S3 method: plot(). object also stores data used create plot users may directly access plotting data create customized plots. didint_plot() can produce either parallel trends plots event study plots.   event study plots parallel trends plots possible specify combination plots like view via ccc argument.   like create customized plots using plotting data, can acccess via DiDIntPlotObj$data.
code: # Generate the DiDIntPlotObj for event study plot res_event <- didint_plot(   "coll", "state", "year", df, event = TRUE,   treated_states = c(71, 58, 64, 59, 85, 57, 72, 61, 34, 88),   treatment_times = c(1991, 1993, 1996, 1997, 1997, 1998, 1998, 1999,                       2000, 2000),   covariates = c("asian", "black", "male") ) #>     Demean Variables: [=>                               ]  1/121  plot(res_event) # For purposes of demonstration, it would be a bit cluttered to show the # parallel trends for each state in the dataset, so here we will just use # a subset df_sub <- df[df$state %in% c(71, 58, 11, 34, 14), ] res_parallel <- didint_plot("coll", "state", "year", df_sub,                             treatment_times = c(1991, 1993, 2000),                             covariates = c("asian", "black", "male"))  plot(res_parallel) plot(res_parallel, ccc = "state") plot(res_event, ccc = c("none", "hom", "int")) head(res_parallel$data) #>   state time    lambda ccc period start_date treat_period period_length #> 1    11 1989 0.4676477 hom      0       1989           NA        1 year #> 2    11 1990 0.3166708 hom      1       1989           NA        1 year #> 3    11 1991 0.4455335 hom      2       1989           NA        1 year #> 4    11 1992 0.5796195 hom      3       1989           NA        1 year #> 5    11 1993 0.6324456 hom      4       1989           NA        1 year #> 6    11 1994 0.4139365 hom      5       1989           NA        1 year head(res_event$data) #>   ccc time_since_treatment         y         se    ci_lower  ci_upper ngroup #> 1 hom                  -11 0.5282917 0.24299986 -2.55931420 3.6158976      2 #> 2 hom                  -10 0.4476755 0.11609859 -0.05185644 0.9472074      3 #> 3 hom                   -9 0.4708055 0.02783482  0.39352366 0.5480874      5 #> 4 hom                   -8 0.4529724 0.03014100  0.37922005 0.5267248      7 #> 5 hom                   -7 0.4970207 0.03668203  0.41028149 0.5837599      8 #> 6 hom                   -6 0.4832311 0.02483194  0.42451293 0.5419493      8 #>   period_length #> 1        1 year #> 2        1 year #> 3        1 year #> 4        1 year #> 5        1 year #> 6        1 year

what: Estimate the ATT using DID-INT — didint
title: Estimate the ATT using DID-INT — didint
text: didint() estimates average effect treatment treated (ATT) using intersection difference--differences developped Karim & Webb (2025). method adjusts covariates may vary across states, time, jointly state time. function R wrapper around Julia implementation provided Didint.jl package. details visit didintrjl documentation site: https://ebjamieson97.github.io/didintrjl/.

title: Estimate the ATT using DID-INT — didint
code: didint(   outcome,   state,   time,   data,   gvar = NULL,   treated_states = NULL,   treatment_times = NULL,   date_format = NULL,   covariates = NULL,   ccc = "int",   agg = "cohort",   weighting = "both",   ref = NULL,   freq = NULL,   freq_multiplier = 1,   start_date = NULL,   end_date = NULL,   nperm = 999,   verbose = TRUE,   seed = sample.int(1e+06, 1),   notyet = NULL,   hc = "hc3",   truejack = FALSE )

title: Estimate the ATT using DID-INT — didint
text: outcome string giving column name outcome variable. state string giving column identifying states. state column character column. time string giving column identifying dates. data data frame containing variables used estimation. gvar String giving column indicates first treatment time state. Use either option combination treated_states treatment_times. treated_states Character values specifying treated state(s). treatment_times Specify treated_states using strings, numbers, Dates, corresponding treated_states. date_format Optional string specifying input date format dates supplied character strings. Applies start_date, end_date, treatment_times data time column strings. covariates Optional string vector strings specifying covariates include. ccc string specifying -INT specification. One "hom", "time", "state", "add", "int" (default "int"). agg string indicating aggregation method. One "cohort", "simple", "state", "sgt", "time" "none". weighting Weighting scheme use. One "", "att", "diff", "none". ref Optional named list indicating reference category categorical covariates. freq Optional string specifying period length staggered adoption. One "year", "month", "week", "day". freq_multiplier Integer multiplier freq. Default 1. start_date Optional earliest date retain data. end_date Optional latest date retain data. nperm Number permutations randomization inference. Default 999. verbose Logical value, TRUE, prints progress randomization inference procedure. seed Integer seed randomization inference. notyet Logical value TRUE, uses pre-treatment periods treated states controls. hc Heteroskedasticity-consistent covariance matrix estimator. One "hc0", "hc1", "hc2", "hc3", "hc4". truejack Logical value, TRUE, re-estimates -INT model first step (ccc option "int" "state").

title: Estimate the ATT using DID-INT — didint
text: DiDIntObj

title: Estimate the ATT using DID-INT — didint
text: arguments treated_states treatment_times must supplied ordering corresponds one another. , first element treated_states refers state treated date given first element treatment_times, . Dates can entered strings, numbers, Date objects. character strings supplied, input format must specified via date_format argument (e.g. "yyyy-mm-dd"). Period grids staggered adoption constructed automatically, based inputted data. Otherwise, period grid can created manually using arguments freq, freq_multiplier, start_date, end_date. information process can seen didintrjl documentation site: https://ebjamieson97.github.io/didintrjl/.

title: Estimate the ATT using DID-INT — didint
text: Karim & Webb (2025). Good Controls Gone Bad: Difference--Differences Covariates. https://arxiv.org/abs/2412.14447 MacKinnon & Webb (2020). Randomization inference difference--differences treated clusters. doi:10.1016/j.jeconom.2020.04.024

title: Estimate the ATT using DID-INT — didint

what: Make event study or parallel trends plots — didint_plot
title: Make event study or parallel trends plots — didint_plot
text: didint_plot() produces either event study plots parallel trends plots depending specified via event argument. parallel trends plots, well event study plots, created using means residualized covariates different model specifications account different violations common causal covaraites (CCC) assumptions.

title: Make event study or parallel trends plots — didint_plot
code: didint_plot(   outcome,   state,   time,   data,   gvar = NULL,   treated_states = NULL,   treatment_times = NULL,   date_format = NULL,   covariates = NULL,   ref = NULL,   ccc = "all",   event = FALSE,   weights = TRUE,   ci = 0.95,   freq = NULL,   freq_multiplier = 1,   start_date = NULL,   end_date = NULL,   hc = "hc3" )

title: Make event study or parallel trends plots — didint_plot
text: outcome string giving column name outcome variable. state string giving column identifying states. state column character column. time string giving column identifying dates. data data frame containing variables used estimation. gvar String giving column indicates first treatment time state. Use either option combination treated_states treatment_times. treated_states Character values specifying treated state(s). treatment_times Specify treated_states using strings, numbers, Dates, corresponding treated_states. date_format Optional string specifying input date format dates supplied character strings. Applies start_date, end_date, treatment_times data time column strings. covariates Optional string vector strings specifying covariates include. ref Optional named list indicating reference category categorical covariates. ccc string specifying -INT specification. combination "none", "hom", "time", "state", "add", "int". , alternatively, "" (default). event logical value used specify event study plots made (TRUE) parallel trends plots made (FALSE). weights logical value,  TRUE, estimates event study plot computed weighted averages state level means period relative treatment period; FALSE, uses unweighted averages. ci number 0 1 used specify size confidence bands. freq Optional string specifying period length staggered adoption. One "year", "month", "week", "day". freq_multiplier Integer multiplier freq. Default 1. start_date Optional earliest date retain data. end_date Optional latest date retain data. hc Heteroskedasticity-consistent covariance matrix estimator. One "hc0", "hc1", "hc2", "hc3", "hc4".

title: Make event study or parallel trends plots — didint_plot
text: DiDIntPlotObj.

text: arguments treated_states treatment_times must supplied ordering corresponds one another. , first element treated_states refers state treated date given first element treatment_times, . Dates can entered strings, numbers, Date objects. character strings supplied, input format must specified via date_format argument (e.g. "yyyy-mm-dd"). Period grids constructed automatically, based inputted data Otherwise, period grid can created manually using arguments freq, freq_multiplier, start_date, end_date. information process can seen didintrjl documentation site: https://ebjamieson97.github.io/didintrjl/.

title: Plot method for DiDIntPlotObj — plot.DiDIntPlotObj
text: x DiDIntPlotObj object. y NULL value passed plot() method. ccc Specify ccc options like plotted data. combination "none", "hom", "time", "state", "add", "int". , alternatively, "" (default). groupmin minimum number states used compute point event study confidence band shown. Defaults 3. window Either NULL vector two elements defining first last period plotted. ... arguments

title: didintrjl 0.2.1
text: Added truejack option, re-estimates -INT model step 1 calculating jackknife set TRUE.

title: didintrjl 0.2.0
text: Added arguments window mingroup plot() method DiDIntPlotObj. new arguments allow user specify range periods plotted, points want confidence band appear case events plots. new arguments require updating DiDInt.jl package Julia v0.6.15.

title: didintrjl 0.1.0
text: didint_plot() now returns DiDIntPlotObj plot() method. DiDIntPlotObj also stores data used make plot users can customize plots choose. anticipated front-end features now implemented.

title: didintrjl 0.0.3
text: Added didint_plot() function updated summary() method DiDIntObj.

title: didintrjl 0.0.2
text: Added coef() summary() methods DiDIntObj.

title: didintrjl 0.0.1
text: Switched using JuliaCall now using JuliaConnectoR. didint() now returns S3 object class DiDIntObj instead raw dataframe. Added print() method DiDIntObj objects level argument display aggregate sub-aggregate results via "agg" "sub" options.

title: didintrjl 0.0.0.9000
text: Initial package setup.
